ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Specify Multiple Remote chronyd NTP Servers for Time Data
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Multiple chronyd NTP Servers for time synchronization should be specified.

ns0:criteria.comment: chrony.conf conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Specify a Remote NTP Server for Time Data
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: A remote NTP Server for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: chrony.conf conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Ctrl-Alt-Del Reboot Activation
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: By default, the system will reboot when the Ctrl-Alt-Del key sequence is pressed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package audit Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package audit should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package chrony Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package chrony should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package cronie Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package cronie should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package firewalld Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package firewalld should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate group.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root group

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate user.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root user

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for all syslog log files should be set correctly.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check permissions of all system log files

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable X Windows Startup By Setting Default SystemD Target
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks /etc/systemd/system/default.target to ensure that the default runlevel target is set to multi-user.target.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service sshd Disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The sshd service should be disabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: package openssh-server removed or service sshd is not configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package libreswan Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package libreswan should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service auditd Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The auditd service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package audit installed and service auditd is configured to start
service auditd is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service chronyd Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The chronyd service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package chrony installed and service chronyd is configured to start
service chronyd is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service crond Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The crond service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package cronie installed and service crond is configured to start
service crond is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service firewalld Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The firewalld service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package firewalld installed and service firewalld is configured to start
service firewalld is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set All Accounts To Have Unique Names
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All accounts on the system should have unique names for proper accountability.

ns0:criteria.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The maximum password age policy should meet minimum requirements.

ns0:criteria.comment: The value PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The minimum password age policy should be set appropriately.

ns0:criteria.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.

ns0:criterion.comment: tests that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: All Password Hashes Shadowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All password hashes should be shadowed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password minimum length should be set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password dcredit Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password dcredit should meet minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for dcredit are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password difok Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password difok should meet minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for difok are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password lcredit Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password lcredit should meet minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for lcredit are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password maxclassrepeat Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password maxclassrepeat should meet minimum requirements using pam_pwquality

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for maxclassrepeat are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password maxrepeat Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password maxrepeat should meet minimum requirements using pam_pwquality

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for maxrepeat are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password minclass Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password minclass should meet the minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for minclass are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password minlen Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password minlen should meet minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: system uses pam_pwquality configured

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password ocredit Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password ocredit should meet minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for ocredit are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check pam_pwquality Existence in system-auth
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check that pam_pwquality.so exists in system-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password retry Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password retry should meet minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: Conditions for retry are satisfied
system is RHEL6 with pam_cracklib configured
system is RHEL7 with pam_pwquality configured
system is Fedora with pam_pwquality configured

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password ucredit Requirements
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password ucredit should meet minimum requirements

ns0:criteria.comment: conditions for ucredit are satisfied

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Limit Password Reuse
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The passwords to remember should be set correctly.

ns0:criteria.comment: remember parameter of pam_unix.so or pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly

ns0:criterion.comment: remember parameter of pam_unix.so is set correctly
remember parameter of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password expiration warning age should be set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

ns0:criterion.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of system-auth
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of password-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Write permissions are disabled for group and other in all directories in Root's Path
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check each directory in root's path and make use it does not grant write permission to group and other

ns0:criteria.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for write permission to group and other in root's path

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Aide Database Must Exist
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The aide database must be initialized.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Test if auditctl is in use for audit rules.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Test if augenrules is enabled for audit rules.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - removexattr

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - setxattr
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Any Attempts to Run chcon
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of chcon is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Any Attempts to Run restorecon
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of restorecon is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of semanage is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Any Attempts to Run setsebool
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of setsebool is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit File Deletion Events
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit files deletion events.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit File Deletion Events - rename
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The deletion of files should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit File Deletion Events - renameat
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The deletion of files should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit File Deletion Events - rmdir
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The deletion of files should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit File Deletion Events - unlink
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The deletion of files should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit File Deletion Events - unlinkat
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The deletion of files should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Make Audit Configuration Immutable
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Force a reboot to change audit rules is enabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - delete_module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - init_module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - insmod
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - modprobe
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - rmmod
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - faillock
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - lastlog
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - tallylog
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Events that Modify the System's Mandatory Access Controls
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules that detect changes to the system's mandatory access controls (SELinux) are enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit Information Export To Media
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules that detect the mounting of filesystems should be enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Events that Modify the System's Network Environment
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The network environment should not be modified by anything other than administrator action. Any change to network parameters should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Events that Modify the System's Network Environment
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The network environment should not be modified by anything other than administrator action. Any change to network parameters should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Events that Modify the System's Network Environment
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The network environment should not be modified by anything other than administrator action. Any change to network parameters should be audited.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of privileged commands are enabled.

ns0:criterion.comment: audit augenrules binaries count matches rules count
audit auditctl binaries count matches rules count

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - chage
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of chage is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - chsh
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of chsh is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - crontab
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of crontab is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - gpasswd
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of gpasswd is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - newgrp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of newgrp is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - pam_timestamp_check
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of pam_timestamp_check is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - passwd
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of passwd is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - postdrop
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of postdrop is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - postqueue
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of postqueue is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of pt_chown is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of ssh_keysign is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - su
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of su is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of sudo is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of sudoedit is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - umount
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of umount is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - unix_chkpwd
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of unix_chkpwd is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - userhelper
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the information on the use of userhelper is enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Process and Session Initiation Information
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules should capture information about session initiation.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit System Administrator Actions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit actions taken by system administrators on the system.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Shutdown System When Auditing Failures Occur
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The system will shutdown when auditing fails.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Adjtimex
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Record attempts to alter time through adjtimex.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Clock_settime
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Record attempts to alter time through clock_settime.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Settimeofday
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Record attempts to alter time through settimeofday.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Stime
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Record attempts to alter time through stime. Note that on 64-bit architectures the stime system call is not defined in the audit system calls lookup table.

ns0:criteria.comment: 32-bit or 64-bit system
audit augenrules or audit auditctl
audit augenrules stime
audit auditctl stime

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through the Localtime File
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Record attempts to alter time through /etc/localtime.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - openat
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - truncate
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit User/Group Modification
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit user/group modification.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit User/Group Modification
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit user/group modification.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit User/Group Modification
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit user/group modification.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit User/Group Modification
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit user/group modification.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit User/Group Modification
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit user/group modification.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Audit User/Group Modification
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Audit user/group modification.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: The syslog Plugin Of the Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: active setting in /etc/audisp/plugins.d/syslog.conf is set to 'yes'

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: 'log_group' Not Set To 'root' In /etc/audit/auditd.conf
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify 'log_group' is not set to 'root' in /etc/audit/auditd.conf.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Email Account to Notify Upon Action
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: action_mail_acct setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain account

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk is Low on Space
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: admin_space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Maximum Log File Size
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: max_log_file setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Maximum Log Size Reached
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: max_log_file_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Maximum Number of Logs to Retain
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: num_logs setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Starting to Run Low on Space
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: System Login Banner Compliance
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The system login banner text should be set correctly.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable Auditing for Processes Which Start Prior to the Audit Daemon
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Look for argument audit=1 in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

ns0:criterion.comment: check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify GRUB_DISABLE_RECOVERY Set to true
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: GRUB_DISABLE_RECOVERY set to 'true' in /etc/default/grub

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Kernel Support for USB via Bootloader Configuration
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Look for 'nousb' argument in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Boot Loader Password
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The grub2 boot loader should have password protection enabled.

ns0:criterion.comment: make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg
make sure a superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set the UEFI Boot Loader Password
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The UEFI grub2 boot loader should have password protection enabled.

ns0:criterion.comment: make sure a password is defined in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg
make sure a superuser is defined in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable GNOME3 Login Warning Banner
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable the GNOME3 Login warning banner.

ns0:criteria.comment: Enable GUI banner and prevent user from changing it

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable GNOME3 Automounting
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The system's default desktop environment, GNOME3, will mount devices and removable media (such as DVDs, CDs and USB flash drives) whenever they are inserted into the system. Disable automount and autorun within GNOME3.

ns0:criteria.comment: Disable GNOME3 automount/autorun and prevent user from changing it

ns0:criterion.comment: Prevent user from changing automount setting
Prevent user from changing automount-open setting
Prevent user from changing autorun setting

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Ctrl-Alt-Del Reboot Key Sequence in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GNOME3 ctrl-alt-del reboot key sequence in GNOME3.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Geolocation in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable GNOME3 Geolocation for the clock and system.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Power Settings in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable GNOME3 power settings.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable the GNOME3 Login Restart and Shutdown Buttons
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GNOME3 Login GUI Restart and Shutdown buttons to all users on the login screen.

ns0:criteria.comment: Disable GUI shutdown and restart buttons and prevent user from changing it

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable All GNOME3 Thumbnailers
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The system's default desktop environment, GNOME3, uses a number of different thumbnailer programs to generate thumbnails for any new or modified content in an opened folder. Disable the execution of these thumbnail applications within GNOME3.

ns0:criteria.comment: Disable Gnome3 Thumbnailers and prevent user from enabling

ns0:criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable User Administration in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable GNOME3's ability to give users some administrative rights.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable the GNOME3 Login User List
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GNOME3 GUI listing of all known users on the login screen.

ns0:criteria.comment: Disable GUI listing of known users and prevent user from changing it

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable WIFI Network Connection Creation in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GNOME3 wireless network creation settings.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable WIFI Network Notification in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GNOME3 wireless network notification.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable the GNOME3 Login Smartcard Authentication
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable smartcard authentication in the GNOME3 Login GUI.

ns0:criteria.comment: Enable smartcard authentication and prevent user from changing it

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable GUI Warning Banner
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable the GUI warning banner.

ns0:criteria.comment: Enable GUI banner and prevent user from changing it

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set the GNOME3 Login Number of Failures
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Set the GNOME3 number of login failure attempts.

ns0:criteria.comment: Set number of login attempts and prevent user from changing it

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Credential Prompting for Remote Access in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure GNOME3 to require credential prompting for remote access.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Encryption for Remote Access in GNOME3
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure GNOME3 to require encryption for remote access connections.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Idle Activation
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Idle activation of the screen saver should be enabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: check screensaver idle activation and prevent user from changing it

ns0:criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure the GNOME3 GUI Screen locking
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The allowed period of inactivity before the screensaver is activated.

ns0:criteria.comment: check screensaver idle delay and prevent user from changing it

ns0:criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Lock Delay After Idle Period
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled immediately or after a delay.

ns0:criteria.comment: Enable screensaver lock and prevent user from changing it

ns0:criterion.comment: screensaver lock delay is set correctly
prevent user from changing screensaver lock delay

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Lock After Idle Period
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: Enable screensaver lock and prevent user from changing it

ns0:criterion.comment: screensaver lock prevent user from changing
screensaver lock delay is set correctly
prevent user from changing screensaver lock delay

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Implement Blank Screensaver
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The GNOME3 screensaver should be blank.

ns0:criteria.comment: Enable blank screensaver and prevent user from changing it

ns0:criterion.comment: screensaver prevent user from changing mode

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Full User Name on Splash Shield
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: GNOME3 screen splash shield should not display full name of logged in user.

ns0:criteria.comment: Disable screensaver user info and prevent user from changing it

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Users Cannot Change GNOME3 Session Settings
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure that users cannot change GNOME3 session idle and lock settings.

ns0:criteria.comment: check screensaver idle delay and prevent user from changing it

ns0:criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay
prevent user from changing screensaver lock delay

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that Interactive Boot is Disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The ability for users to perform interactive startups should be disabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Prelinking
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The prelinking feature can interfere with the operation of checksum integrity tools (e.g. AIDE), mitigates the protection provided by ASLR, and requires additional CPU cycles by software upgrades.

ns0:criteria.comment: Conditions for prelinking disabled are satisfied
System is RHEL6 with prelinking disabled
System is RHEL7 or Fedora and prelink RPM is not installed or prelinking is disabled
System is RHEL7 or Fedora
prelink RPM package not installed or prelinking disabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Core Dumps
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Core dumps for all users should be disabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Last Login/Access Notification
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure the system to notify users of last login/access using pam_lastlog.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Implement Local DB for DConf User Profile
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The DConf User profile should have the local DB configured.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Yum gpgcheck Globally Activated
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled For All Yum or Dnf Package Repositories
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure all yum or dnf repositories utilize signature checking.

ns0:criteria.comment: ensure all yum or dnf repositories utilize signiature checking

ns0:criterion.comment: verify no gpgpcheck=0 present in /etc/yum.repos.d files

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: File grub.cfg Owned By root Group
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The grub.cfg file should be owned by the root group. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that System Executables Have Root Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, /usr/sbin, /usr/local/bin, /usr/local/sbin, /usr/libexec, and objects therein, are owned by root.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that Shared Library Files Have Root Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that /lib, /lib64, /usr/lib, /usr/lib64, /lib/modules, and objects therein, are owned by root.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

ns0:criteria.comment: directories are root owned
log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that System Executables Have Restrictive Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that binary files under /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, /usr/sbin, /usr/local/bin, /usr/local/sbin, and /usr/libexec are not group-writable or world-writable.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: File grub.cfg Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions for grub.cfg should be set to 0600 (or stronger). By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Proper Permissions User Home Directories
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify that Shared Library Files Have Restrictive Permissions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that /lib, /lib64, /usr/lib, /usr/lib64, /lib/modules, and objects therein, are not group-writable or world-writable.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Find files unowned by a group
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All files should be owned by a group

ns0:criterion.comment: Check all files and make sure they are owned by a group

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: File grub.cfg Owned By root User
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The grub.cfg file should be owned by the root user. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Banner for FTP Users
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: To trace malicious activity facilitated by the FTP service, it must be configured to ensure that all commands sent to the FTP server are logged using the verbose vsftpd log format.

ns0:criteria.comment: FTP is not being used or the conditions are met
FTP configuration conditions are not set or are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Banner for FTP Users
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This setting will cause the system greeting banner to be used for FTP connections as well.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: All GIDs Are Present In /etc/group
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All GIDs referenced in /etc/passwd must be defined in /etc/group.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable GDM Automatic Login
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow users to automatically login.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable GDM Guest Login
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow guest users to login.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package Antivirus Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Antivirus software should be installed.

ns0:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package McAfeeVSEForLinux Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: McAfee Antivirus software should be installed.

ns0:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries and Linux Agent
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries (MFErt) and Linux Agent (MFEcma).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS) software should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the McAfee Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module if it is absolutely necessary. If SELinux is enabled, do not install or enable this module.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: CentOS 6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is CentOS 6

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: CentOS 7
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is CentOS 7

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Fedora

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:criterion.comment: CPE vendor is 'fedoraproject' and product is 'fedora'

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Installed operating system is part of the Unix family
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is part of the Unix OS family

ns0:criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Scientific Linux 6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Scientific Linux 6

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Scientific Linux 7
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Scientific Linux 7

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: WRLinux
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Wind River Linux

ns0:criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check if the scan target is a container
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it does then we consider to be a docker filesystem.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check if the scan target is a machine
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it doesn't then we consider to be host filesystem or virtual machine.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable dccp Kernel Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The kernel module dccp should be disabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable usb-storage Kernel Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The kernel module usb-storage should be disabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /dev/shm
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /dev/shm. The nodev mount option should be specified for /dev/shm.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to /dev/shm
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: It can be dangerous to allow the execution of binaries from world-writable temporary storage directories such as /dev/shm. The noexec mount option prevents binaries from being executed out of /dev/shm.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /dev/shm
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /dev/shm. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /home
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid mount option should be set for user home directory partitions such as /home. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these directories.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /tmp. The nodev mount option should be specified for /tmp.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nosuid Option to /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /tmp. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

ns0:criterion.comment: Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

ns0:criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure insecure_locks is disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify No netrc Files Exist
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The .netrc files contain login information used to auto-login into FTP servers and reside in the user's home directory. Any .netrc files should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: System Accounts Do Not Run a Shell
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The root account is the only system account that should have a login shell.

ns0:criterion.comment: Test shell defined for UID from <0, UID_MIN -1>
Test shell defined for reserved system UIDs
Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package dconf Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package dconf should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package gdm Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package gdm should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package net-snmp Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package net-snmp should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package openssh-server Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package openssh-server should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package prelink Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package prelink should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package vsftpd Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package vsftpd should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package xorg-x11-server-common Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package xorg-x11-server-common should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Require Authentication for Single-User Mode
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The requirement for a password to boot into single-user mode should be configured correctly.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Serial Port Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to serial port interfaces helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify File Hashes with RPM
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify the RPM digests of system binaries using the RPM database.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify File Ownership And Permissions Using RPM
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify the integrity of installed packages by comparing the installed files with information about the files taken from the package metadata stored in the RPM database.

ns0:criterion.comment: user ownership of all files matches local rpm database
group ownership of all files matches local rpm database
mode of all files matches local rpm database

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Virtual Console Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to virtual console devices helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Change the default firewalld zone to drop
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Change the default firewalld zone to drop.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set SHA512 Password Hashing Algorithm in /etc/login.defs
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password hashing algorithm should be set correctly in /etc/login.defs.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SNMP default communities disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP default communities must be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SNMP use newer protocols
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP version 1 and 2c must not be enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Empty Passwords
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable SSH Support for Rhosts RSA Authentication
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSH can allow authentication through the obsolete rsh command through the use of the authenticating user's SSH keys. This should be disabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable root Login via SSH
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Root login via SSH should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable SSH Support for User Known Hosts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSH can allow system users host-based authentication to connect to systems if a cache of the remote systems public keys are available. This should be disabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable X11 Forwarding
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable X11Forwarding to encrypt X11 remote connections over SSH.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set OpenSSH Idle Timeout Interval
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH idle timeout interval should be set to an appropriate value.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set ClientAliveCountMax for User Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH ClientAliveCountMax should be set to an appropriate value (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set OpenSSH LogLevel to INFO
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH LogLevel should be set to INFO.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set OpenSSH authentication attempt limit (MaxAuthTries)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH MaxAuthTries should be set to an appropriate value.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Use Only Strong Ciphers
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Only use strong ciphers.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Use Only Strong MACs
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Only use strong MACs.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Kernel Runtime Parameter "kernel.exec-shield" Check
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The kernel runtime parameter "kernel.exec-shield" should not be disabled and set to 1 on 32-bit systems.

ns0:criteria.comment: system is RHEL6

ns0:criterion.comment: kernel runtime parameter kernel.exec-shield set to 1
kernel runtime parameter kernel.exec-shield set to 1
NX is supported and is not disabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Kernel Runtime Parameter IPv6 Check
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Disables IPv6 for all network interfaces.

ns0:criteria.comment: IPv6 disabled or net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set correctly

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" Parameter Runtime Check
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" parameter should be set to "1" in system runtime.

ns0:criterion.comment: kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" Parameter Configuration Check
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" parameter should be set to "1" in the system configuration.

ns0:criterion.comment: kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for 64-bit Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for 64-bit architectures to be used by other tests

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for PPC and PPCLE Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for PPC PPC64LE architecture to be used by other tests

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for x86 Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for x86 architecture to be used by other tests

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for x86_64 Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for x86_64 architecture to be used by other tests

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure more than one chronyd NTP server is set
Ensure at least one NTP server is set

ns4:symlink_test.comment: Disable Ctrl-Alt-Del key sequence override exists

ns4:file_test.comment: System log files are owned by root group
System log files are owned by root
Permissions of system log files are 0600

ns3:variable_test.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd
The value of PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: test that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns3:variable_test.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_LEN should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Test if remember attribute of pam_unix.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Test if remember attribute of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ns3:variable_test.comment: The value of PASS_WARN_AGE should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/system-auth (authfail)
Check if pam_faillock_so is called in account phase of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
Check maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/password-auth (authfail)
Check if pam_faillock_so is called in account phase of /etc/pam.d/password-auth
check preauth maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
check authfail maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
check authfail maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
check preauth maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/password-auth

ns4:file_test.comment: Check if there aren't directories in root's path having write permission set for group or other
Testing existence of new aide database file
Testing existence of operational aide database file

ns3:variable_test.comment: audit augenrules binaries count matches rules count
audit auditctl binaries count matches rules count

ns3:textfilecontent54_test.comment: check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg files. Superuser is not root, admin, or administrator

make sure a password is defined in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

Prevent user from changing autorun setting

Prevent enabling of wifi notification capability
